section.heading: Limitations on less-lethal weapons acquired by District law enforcement agencies; reporting requirements.

para.text: District law enforcement agencies shall maintain the following information regarding any less-lethal weapon in their inventory on a publicly accessible website:
A description of the less-lethal weapon, including:
How the less-lethal weapon is used or deployed;
The physiological and psychological effect that the less-lethal weapon has on people; and
Whether the less-lethal weapon is indiscriminate in nature or if it can be targeted at specific individuals in a crowd;
Any technical documentation issued or published by the manufacturer or distributor of the less-lethal weapon;
An explanation for the law enforcement agency's need for the less-lethal weapon;
A description of the personnel who will use, be equipped with, or have access to the less-lethal weapon;

A description of the training those personnel have or will receive on how to use or deploy the less-lethal weapon, including how the training addresses the requirements of Chapter 3A of this title; and
The total price of the less-lethal weapons sought.

Before acquiring a new type of less-lethal weapon, MPD shall publish on a publicly accessible website the information described in subsection (a)(1) of this section at least 28 days prior to acquiring or purchasing the new type of less-lethal weapon.
